block.p: A Taste of the North Sea

Fresh herring from the North Sea have arrived and through the end of the month will be featured at Aquagrill, 210 Spring Street (Avenue of the Americas), (212) 274-0505; Lily's in the Roger Smith Hotel, 501 Lexington Avenue (47th Street), (212) 755-1400 or (212) 838-0844; through June 22 at the Oyster Bar and Restaurant in Grand Central Terminal, (212) 490-6650; and through Saturday on a herring buffet at Aquavit, 65 East 55th Street, (212) 307-7311, $27 at lunch, $48 at dinner. The herring are available retail at Russ & Daughters, 179 East Houston Street (Orchard Street), (212) 475-4880.

Lorna Sass, the author of ''Whole Grains Every Day, Every Way'' (Clarkson Potter, 2006), will talk about ancient grains and their modern uses tomorrow from 7 to 9 p.m. at Stony Brook University Center for Wine, Food and Culture, 401 Park Avenue South (28th Street). There will be a tasting of grain dishes paired with wines. Tickets are $20: (631) 632-9404 or stonybrook.edu/winecenter.

The University Settlement on the Lower East Side, one of the city's oldest settlement houses, has teamed up with Astor Wines and Spirits to offer cases of wine, with about 25 percent of the purchase price going to the settlement's programs.

The cases, $150 each, consist of three bottles each of 2005 Lillà Trebbiano, a crisp Italian white; 2006 Torrontés Plata, a well-perfumed white from Argentina; the Shadow 2002, a syrah from Edmunds St. John in California; and Castello della Paneretta 2004, a complex Chianti. Shipping anywhere in New York State is free. To order: (212) 674-7500 or astorwines.com.
